intro: Tragia howardii, commonly known as the desert tickseed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water. Tragia howardii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in sandy or rocky habitats.
